item.title: Ukraine v England: Three Lions travel to Rome for Euro 2020 quarter-final
item.description: England will attempt to qualify for their first European Championship semi-final for 25 years when they face Ukraine at Euro 2020 on Saturday.

item.title: Ethiopia Tigray conflict: Famine hits 400,000, UN warns
item.description: Millions more are at risk of starvation due to the conflict in Tigray, the organisation says.

item.title: US companies hit by 'colossal' cyber-attack
item.description: A cyber-security firm says it believes the Russia-linked REvil ransomware gang is responsible.

item.title: Miami building collapse: Firefighter's 7-year-old daughter found dead
item.description: She is the third child to be recovered from the site of the collapsed 12-storey block.

item.title: Pilot remarkably calm as his Boeing 737 plunges into sea
item.description: Two pilots are in a stable condition after coast guards rescued them off the coast of Hawaii.

item.title: Covid: Broadbent and Walliams in Covid jab campaign film
item.description: The video, set to the tune The Rhythm Of Life from Sweet Charity, encourages people to get their jabs.

item.title: Andy Murray out of Wimbledon in third round
item.description: Andy Murray's Wimbledon run comes to an end after losing to Canadian 10th seed Denis Shapovalov, while Dan Evans is also out.

item.title: Angela Merkel hopes to open up travel for double-jabbed visitors to Germany
item.description: Quarantine may be eased for fully vaccinated visitors to Germany from the UK, Angela Merkel says.

item.title: Belarus closes border to Ukraine over coup claim
item.description: President Alexander Lukashenko claims he has uncovered a foreign plot to overthrow his regime.

item.title: Michael Gove and Sarah Vine separating and 'finalising divorce'
item.description: The cabinet minister and his wife have "drifted apart" and "no-one else is involved", friends say.

item.title: Croydon stabbing: Teen arrested after 16-year-old killed
item.description: A 15-year-old boy is arrested in connection with the death of a 16-year-old boy in south London.

item.title: Italy edge Belgium to set up Spain semi-final
item.description: Italy set up a Euro 2020 semi-final match with Spain after edging an exhilarating tie with Belgium in Munich.

item.title: Music fans' confusion over insurance cover
item.description: Consumer group Which? says people with tickets to gigs or major events are often unaware of the extent of cover.

item.title: The Papers: Quarantine 'to end' for fully jabbed, and 'Yes we Kane'
item.description: Saturday's papers feature reports about what life could look like for those given two Covid vaccines.

item.title: 'I used drugs every day in lockdown, but now I'm drug-free'
item.description: Lee says he went from using drugs once a week to every day during the lockdown - but now he's in recovery.

item.title: 'Hiking as a black person in the US can be nerve-racking'
item.description: Mardi is part of Outdoor Afro, an organisation which encourages black nature lovers into the outdoors.

item.title: The cat with more than 50,000 social media followers
item.description: Pet influencers have become the latest social media stars with the pandemic fuelling content demand.

item.title: Week in pictures: 26 June - 2 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Can esports be more inclusive and accessible for people with disabilities?
item.description: A pilot event has taken place to work out how competitive gaming can include more people.

item.title: Soul Cap: Afro swim cap Olympic rejection 'heartbreaking' for black swimmers
item.description: The governing body says Soul Caps are unsuitable as they don't follow "the natural form of the head".

item.title: Kim Leadbeater: Sister of Jo Cox is new Batley and Spen MP
item.description: Kim Leadbeater says a key part of her by-election success was being "born and bred" in the area.

item.title: Comedian Joe Lycett says he staged TV walkout as a plastics protest
item.description: The comedian appeared to storm off Steph's Packed Lunch on Channel 4 on Thursday.

item.title: Vaccine hesitancy: Your job or the jab?
item.description: Health workers once on the frontline of the pandemic are now embroiled in a row over vaccine mandates.

item.title: Strolling crocodile sparks panic in India village
item.description: Wildlife officials caught the animal and released it into a nearby river.

item.title: Miami condo collapse: A boom, then the ground shook
item.description: Witnesses recount the terrifying night of the Champlain Tower collapse and the week that shook Miami.

item.title: Then and now: Arctic sea-ice feeling the heat
item.description: As Arctic sea-ice melts in a warming world, it causes the world to heat more rapidly.

item.title: Meet Tai Verdes, the rising star who funded his career by winning a dating show
item.description: Tai Verdes didn't know how to make it in the music industry - but a reality TV jackpot sorted that out.

item.title: The codes helping visually-impaired people shop
item.description: New technology that allows phones to read out labelling is about to make supermarkets much more accessible.

item.title: Fire-and-rehire: What is it and why is it controversial?
item.description: Controversy surrounds companies which dismiss their workers and rehire them on worse contracts.

item.title: Lyme disease: 'People say I don't look ill'
item.description: Yen Lau describes her Lyme disease as an "invisible disease" that can cause days of sickness and fatigue.

item.title: Why are Chinese tech brands flocking to Euro 2020?
item.description: Four big Chinese firms have signed up to sponsor the European football tournament this year.

item.title: Parents of children called Alexa challenge Amazon
item.description: Youngsters are being bullied over their name - also the default wake word for the tech firm's smart speakers.

item.title: 'Don't judge me, I am human' - US sprint star Richardson banned for marijuana use
item.description: US sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson receives a one-month ban after testing positive for marijuana - and is set to miss the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Britain's Andy Murray loses in straight sets to Canada's Denis Shapovalov
item.description: Watch highlights as Andy Murray's run at Wimbledon comes to end with a third-round 6-4 6-2 6-2 defeat by Canadian Denis Shapovalov.

item.title: Euro 2020: Watch all the angles of Lorenzo Insigne's stunning strike for Italy
item.description: Watch all the angles of Lorenzo Insigne's beautiful curling strike to put Italy 2-0 up against Belgium in their quarter-final tie in Munich.

item.title: Determined Djokovic, outstanding outifts & a proper hot dog - day five best bits
item.description: Watch some of the best bits from day five at Wimbledon including Nick Kyrgios accidentally hitting a ball at Venus Williams and some well dressed spectators.

item.title: Euro 2020: Italy set up Spain semi after beating Belgium
item.description: Watch highlights as Lorenzo Insigne's super strike from range helped Italy beat Belgium 2-1 to advance to the semi-finals of Euro 2020 facing Spain at Wembley.

item.title: 'Exciting' midfield duo to start first Tour match as Lions hope Jones can return for Tests
item.description: Alun Wyn Jones has the credentials to defy the odds and return for the British and Irish Lions Test series against South Africa, kicking coach Neil Jenkins says.

item.title: 'A signal Italy are here to win Euro 2020' - but agony for 'irreplaceable' Spinazzola
item.description: There has been no better team than Italy at Euro 2020 and they are now two games from glory after dumping out Belgium - so how far can they go?

item.title: When in Rome... The England fans who will be at the match
item.description: England fans with tickets for Saturday's quarter-final tell us how they've managed to get there.

item.title: Should we raucously celebrate a football win in a pandemic?
item.description: Scenes of England fans celebrating beating Germany have delighted many - but raised some eyebrows.

item.title: England vs Ukraine: Euro 2020 quarter-final - what threat will Ukraine pose in Rome?
item.description: Will Andriy Shevchenko's Ukraine add to list of Euro 2020 shocks when they play England in their quarter-final in Rome on Saturday?

item.title: England v Ukraine: Three Lions' defence is perfect platform for Euro 2020 success - Rio Ferdinand
item.description: Former England defender and BBC Sport columnist Rio Ferdinand says the Three Lions' strength as a unit at the back has become their biggest strength as a team.

item.title: Euro 2020: Ukrainians unite over football after years of struggle
item.description: Hit by years of war and long months of Covid lockdown, Ukrainians dare to dream of football success.

item.title: Karen Carney column: Experiencing Euro 2020 as a pitchside reporter
item.description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Karen Carney discusses what she has seen as a pitchside reporter at Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,00 fans next week, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: There is 'no reason' for England's final Covid restrictions to last beyond 19 July, the government says.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: The government says it's confident an Indian-made AZ vaccine used in the UK won't affect people's ability to travel abroad.

item.title: What are the social distancing rules and when could they end?
item.description: It's not clear whether we will still have to wear masks and socially distance once lockdown eases.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as almost 45 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: How many cases are in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.
